p: Influenza viruses are a major cause of respiratory illness and mortality worldwide, causing approximately 500,000 deaths annually from seasonal epidemics alone ( 1). An additional and potentially much more serious burden arises from zoonotic emergence of pandemic viruses from birds, the natural reservoir of influenza viruses. The most notorious of these events, in 1918, claimed the lives of an estimated 50 million people, while the latest pandemic to date, in 2009, killed over 250,000 worldwide ( 2). In order to mitigate the impact of the next influenza pandemic and reduce the seasonal burden, new approaches to thwart influenza virus are required. A first step toward novel treatment is an enhanced understanding of the interactions between virus and host cell.
